social_posts.post_text: Fun fact, people with tattoos are way more fun to see naked.

The #bitcoinhalving is less than a year away. 

This event is coded into #bitcoin and reduces the daily amount of #bitcoins distributed to miners by 50%. 

And it happens ever 4-years!

Bitcoin will only become infinitely more scarce, get yours now.

Power makes up 90+% of your #bitcoinmining expenses, therefore your cost is one of the driving factors in determining your profitability. 

Right now the industry standard for at-scale miners is 4-5 cents per kWh. 

I believe it will drop further over time, whether that is the actual contracted or market rate, or an improvement in operational efficiency. 

The sure thing is that #bitcoinminers and #utilities will continue to partner as demand response becomes increasingly more important as #renewables become increasing more deployed.

#Utilities have to overproduce energy to meet peak events. 

#Bitcoinminers consume that excess energy when it isn't needed by the grid and give it back when it is. 

It isn't complicated. #Bitcoinmining makes energy production more efficient and sustainable.

Throwback to my month in #bitcoinbeach

#elsalvador🇸🇻 had been leading the charge for federal adoption of this freedom tool 

#bitcoin is legal tender there, and anyone who accepts credit cards has to accept #btc

Do you think this is a good or bad move for the country?

There is a dark side to #renewableenergy.

Traditional power sources like natural gas and coal are known for their predictability and consistency, supplying energy to the grid as needed through continuous burning.

On the other hand, renewables, as their name suggests, are inherently inconsistent and unpredictable. For instance, solar power generation is dependent on sunlight, and wind power relies on the presence of strong winds.

Moreover, the cost of batteries for large-scale energy storage is currently prohibitively high, making it difficult to justify their use.

However, #Bitcoinmining offers two significant advantages for renewable energy production:

#Bitcoinminers can utilize excess energy during periods of low demand on the grid. This is crucial because constantly turning power operations on and off is highly inefficient.

Bitcoin miners are mobile, allowing them to consume power directly on-site. This is especially valuable as deploying transmission infrastructure is both expensive and complex. By engaging in profitable, energy-consuming activities like Bitcoin mining until the transmission infrastructure is ready, renewable projects become more financially viable. This drastically alters the traditional model, making the deployment of renewable projects much more feasible.

How to access time, location and financial freedom: 

1. Learn a skill you can monetize, preferably remotely. For me it was sales. For you it can be coding, coaching, marketing, media production, customer support, affiliate marketing… there are endless options. 

2. Move somewhere where your dollar goes further. I’ve lived in 6 different countries over the past 2-years. Colombia, Mexico, and Guatemala are all viable digital nomad options where you can live like a king for cheap. 

3. Build up your network. They will level you up, motivate you, give you opportunities and perspective.

4. Build up your credit and leverage OPM (other people’s money). This is how you truly build wealth after you’ve done step 1 and created some solid income for yourself. 

5. Invest in assets that create cashflow. Bitcoin mining, real estate, cars, buy boring businesses, atms, payment processors. So many options, just need to research and assess your risk tolerance.

I always get asked “how” I’m able to travel full-time and still make money. 

The truth is, making $5-$10k a month in todays economy is easy. 

You just need to start working on the right things, the things that actually move the needle. I see so many people going through the motions because they equate being busy to being productive. 

I’ve spent my career focusing on ONLY doing the things that drive the most possible value. That’s how I’ve generated close to $30M in sales by the age of 25. That’s how I’ve lived in 6-different countries in the past 2-years. 

Don’t keep repeating the same actions that produce no results. Learn how to actually provide value to the market and then continually asses if you are or if you are just running in circles.

#Bitcoin is a decentralized network which means when I turn my #bitcoinmine off, the network does not go down. 

Compared that to a traditional data center, when you turn those computers off, whatever website they are hosting or critical function they are providing stops. 

For this reason, traditional data centers cannot provide #demandresponse to the grid like bitcoin miners can. 

We have a flexible load, and in the age of #renewables that is critical.

#bitcoinminers can leverage energy sources that nobody in the world can use…

Due to our mobility, miners can connect to stranded energy that is yet to have transmission connected, flared gas that is too expensive to justify capturing and moving for use, and more. 

This is important because the age of “green” is really the age of efficiency. Nothing is without cost, the question is how much.

3 THINGS I DID TO MAKE $1M BY 25 ⬇️

1. Took risk. Creating generational wealth starts with one risk-taker. Too many people are comfortable being comfortable, don’t be that guy. I dropped out of college after 2-years. I moved halfway across the country, to a city where I knew nobody to start a Bitcoin mining company. I sold all my stuff and went nomadic with very little saved up. Take risks, you will learn more about yourself than any class will ever teach.

2. Learn a monetizable skill. How can you expect to make real money if you provide no value to the market? Too many people want to get rich but aren’t willing to put in the work. Figure out what you are naturally good at, systems, sales, content, marketing funnels, coding, coaching - then become GREAT at it. This is what separates the replaceables from non. 

3. Work SMARTER, not harder. Far too often I see people working just because the equate being “busy” to being productive. This is literally the worst thing you can do with your time. Sure, it’ll take some time and feedback to learn what skills are truly driving results, but when you find them…double the fuck down. We are in a skill based economy now, but even more we are in a results based economy. There are too many talkers, be a doer and even better, an achiever.

Capacity factor for #renewables is a joke compared to non-renewables. 

The concept of being able to burn more based on demand is efficient, the concept of having to turn the entire thing on or off based on demand in not. 

#Bitcoinmining greatly helps fix this issue by consuming off-peak power, ensuring a renewable power source can stay on. 

This lowers the cost of production, increases profitability and makes the whole thing most efficient.
There is a HUGE problem with energy production which #bitcoinminning fixes…

ONLY PAGE 
I like Credit, Assets & ₿itcoin…🚀
Tulum, México📍
